intro: Phacelia texana, commonly known as bluecurls, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the stems are often branched. Phacelia texana is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
